newsitem.title: CHINA: FOCUS-Hong Kong index seen testing all-time high.
newsitem.headline: FOCUS-Hong Kong index seen testing all-time high.

text.p: Hong Kong's Hang Seng Index staged a strong technical rebound on Friday to score a record closing high and looks set to test its intra-day record high next week, analysts said.
The Hang Seng Index soared 386.06 points, or 2.60 percent, to 15,225.29, beating the previous closing high of 15,196.79 set on June 29.
The blue-chip index hit an all-time high of 15,363.61 on July 3.
The market shrugged off weak sentiment weighing on prices since Britain handed back Hong Kong to China on July 1, thanks to renewed interest in red-chip stocks and technical buying, analysts said.
"Technically speaking the market should go up further next week since the Hang Seng breached the record to close at a new high," said Franco Tong, sales manager at New China Hong Kong.
Hopes of asset injections and stake purchases boosted red chips, with the Hang Seng China-Affiliated Corporations Index jumping 134.43 points, or 4.22 percent, to finish at 3,319.45.
Banks were broadly higher, with smaller banks lifted by hopes they might be targets of mainland companies following news that COSCO Pacific Ltd planned to take a stake in Liu Chong Hing Bank.
"The banking sector should continue to benefit from the news," Tong said.
Howard Gorges, vice chairman at South China Holdings, said the rebound had surprised investors and he expected more next week.
"It's a very good rebound," he said.
One local broker also pointed to the futures market, where prices closed at a premium to the cash market.
"The blue-chip index will definitely test the all-time high next week given that index futures closed at a premium to the spot index," he said.
July index futures jumped 445 points to close at 15,335, a 110-point premium to the spot index.
